publicationStmt.p: Distributed by Digital Scholarship Services at Lafayette College

lg.l: BONNELL, James, (the Life and Character of), the Accomptant General of Ireland, by WILLIAM HAMILTON. 12mo, calf neat, 10s 6d.
On the Fly-leaf is the following: “This Book belonged to Dean Swift: I bought it at the auction of Dr. Barret's library among other books of the Dean's.──J. FINLAY.
On the other fly leaf is, “The following in the hand-writing of Dean Swift.──J. F.\quote not closed\Y44B#5D1

Y44B#5D1 1 `Thus James Bonnell lived, plainly doth appear, Y44B#5D1 2 A Book so Thick, a copper plate so neat,Y44B#5D1 3 To prove his money, like his life well spent:Y44B#5D1 4 They likewise here do Fix his monument,Y44B#5D1 5 Who, as a mark upon his sacred Dust,Y44B#5D1 6 Oblidged the Public with his pretty bust.Y44B#5D1 7 What's wanting to make the book worth minding,Y44B#5D1 8 Is easily got, A pretty Binding.Y44B#5D1 9 Then surely none can doubt the book will sell,Y44B#5D1 10 James Bonnell lived and dyed so well;Y44B#5D1 11 Yet Thanks to the Gods his wife may wish up,Y44B#5D1 12 There survived a man not yet a Bishop.quote not closedY44B#5D1
